title: After Zelenskyy meeting, Trump calls on Ukraine and Russia to ‘stop where they are’ and end the war
byline: President Donald Trump on Friday called on Kyiv and Moscow to “stop where they are” and end their brutal war following a lengthy White House meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

title: Heavy showers above 100mm expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Meteorology Department states that showers or thundershowers will occur in most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m.

title: Prison Jailor arrested for aiding drug and phone supply to inmate
byline: A Prison Jailor has been arrested by the Kalutara North Police for allegedly aiding and abetting a woman in an attempt to supply narcotics and mobile phones to an inmate at the Kalutara Prison.

title: Sri Lanka records over 1.8 mln tourist arrivals so far in 2025
byline: The Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) reports that the number of foreign tourist arrivals to the country in 2025 has surpassed 1.8 million as of October 15.

title: Suspect arrested with over Rs. 3 mln in cash from drug trafficking
byline: A suspect has been arrested in Polonnaruwa while in possession of Rs. 3,024,900 in cash, believed to have been earned through drug trafficking, police said.

title: Britain’s Prince Andrew gives up title of Duke of York
byline: Britain’s Prince Andrew said on Friday he would give up using his title of Duke of York following years of criticism about his behaviour and connections to the late U.S. sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Afghanistan pull out of tri-nation series after Pakistani airstrikes kill 3 cricketers
byline: The Afghanistan Cricket Board (ACB) pulled out of the upcoming Tri-Nation Series involving Pakistan and Sri Lanka amid the ongoing military tensions with Pakistan.

title: Several spill gates of Rajanganaya and Angamuwa tanks opened
byline: The Director of Water Management, Eng. H.M.P.S.D. Herath, has reported that the Rajanganaya and Angamuwa reservoirs are currently open due to heavy rainfall in the region.

title: Gold prices in Sri Lanka drop by Rs. 20,000
byline: Market data indicates that the price of gold in Sri Lanka has decreased by around Rs. 20,000 compared to yesterday (17).

title: Tamil medium schools in two provinces to get special holiday on Tuesday
byline: A special holiday has been declared for all Tamil medium schools in the Central and Uva provinces on 21 October (Tuesday) in view of the Deepavali festival which falls on 20 October (Monday).

title: Port City Colombo named Asia-Pacific’s Best Knowledge Zone for 2025
byline: Port City Colombo (PCC) has been named the Best Knowledge Zone in Asia-Pacific at the Global Free Zones of the Year 2025 awards organised by fDi Intelligence, a division of the Financial Times.

title: Landslide warnings extended for 11 districts
byline: Early landslide warnings issued by the National Building and Research Organisation (NBRO) for multiple areas in eleven districts have been extended, as heavy rainfall continues across parts of the island.

title: Attorney Gunaratne Wanninayake appears before Mt Lavinia Police
byline: Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake has arrived at the Mount Lavinia Police today to give a statement regarding an incident involving the threatening and obstruction of duties of a police constable at the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court premises.

title: China and US agree to fresh trade talks
byline: China and the United States agreed on Saturday (Oct 18) to conduct another round of trade negotiations in the coming week, as the world’s two biggest economies seek to avoid another damaging tit-for-tat tariff battle.

title: David Attenborough, 99, breaks record as oldest Daytime Emmy winner
byline: Paul Telfer of “Days of Our Lives” and Nancy Lee Grahn of “General Hospital” won lead acting honors at the Daytime Emmys on Friday, with ABC’s “General Hospital” claiming six trophies in the major categories, including drama series.

title: Ishara Sewwandi taken out of CCD again for further investigations
byline: The wanted fugitive Ishara Sewwandi, who was recently arrested in Nepal and extradited to Sri Lanka, has been taken out of the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) today for further investigations, police said.

title: President says aware that some individuals within political and state machinery involved in drug-related activities
byline: During the ceremony for the Presentation of the President’s Colours to the Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) and the Commissioning of Cadet Officers, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake addressed the newly commissioned officers, emphasizing the significance of their responsibilities.

title: Suspect wanted over Borella shooting nabbed at BIA
byline: A suspect has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake in connection with the recent shooting incident in the Kader Nana Watte area in Borella, while attempting to leave the country for Dubai, police said.

title: Nvidia unveils first Blackwell chip wafer made with TSMC in US
byline: Nvidia uveiled on Friday the first U.S.-made Blackwell wafer, produced at TSMC’s semiconductor manufacturing facility in Phoenix, as demand for AI chips accelerates.

title: Court backlogs to be cleared by December 31 - Judicial Service Commission
byline: The Judicial Service Commission (JSC) has issued a circular informing that all pending case backlogs in courts must be cleared on or before 31 December 2025.

title: Over 650 suspects arrested during special island-wide police raids
byline: Sri Lanka Police announced that a total of 654 suspects were arrested during island-wide operations within yesterday.

title: NTC implements special bus service for long weekend
byline: The National Transport Commission (NTC) has announced that a special bus operation plan will be implemented for the upcoming long weekend and the Deepavali festival which falls on 20 October 2025.

title: Parliament to debate drug price regulations next week
byline: Parliament is scheduled to debate the regulations pertaining to the control of drug prices on 21 October 2025.

title: Police obtain 90-day detention order on ‘Ishara Sewwandi’
byline: The Ministry of Defence has granted permission for the police to detain and interrogate ‘Ishara Sewwandi’ for 90 days.

title: Six spill gates of Rajanganaya Reservoir opened by 6 feet
byline: The Department of Irrigation has reported that six spill gates of Rajanganaya reservoir are currently open due to heavy rainfall in the island.

title: Fire breaks out at Dhaka Airport; All flights suspended
byline: A major fire broke out at the cargo terminal of Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport in Dhaka on Saturday, forcing the suspension of all flights.

title: Sri Lanka to seek Interpol Red Notices for athletes who fled 2022 C’wealth Games
byline: Sri Lanka will seek Interpol red notices for the arrest of athletes who fled the 2022 Commonwealth Games village in Birmingham and failed to return home, a court was informed.

title: Fishermen issue requires sensitive handling and sustainable solutions, says PM Harini in India
byline: Sri Lankan Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya highlighted Colombo’s concern over Indian fishermen venturing into the island nation’s waters, even as she pitched her country as a “complimentary” partner for India’s ‘Viksit Bharat 2047’ vision.
